posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.55 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • We made it easier to select additional pictures when Limited Access photo permissions are enabled in iOS. The Manage button has been repositioned so that it’s always visible, and updating your chosen selection is so fast that it’s never a photo finish.
  • Now when you tap on a notification during a voice or video call, the call will automatically minimize to show the relevant chat without any extra steps. Save your extra steps (especially when they’re taps) for tap dancing.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.54 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.55.0.722-beta

62 new commits since 7.54.0.717-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.55 [1]

  • Periodic cleanup of FeatureFlags [2]

  • Use separate strings for app and system settings [3]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.69.0 [4]

  • Consolidate pre key refresh/rotate methods [5]

  • Use system localization for currency formatting [6]

  • Update max group call size in App Store description [7]

  • Invert order of menu items for limited photo view [8]

  • Fix multi-line photo picker permissions label [9]

  • Further isolate tests that should be isolated [10]

  • Format number when re-registering [11]

  • Don’t set httpBody for TSRequests [12]

  • Always use /v2/groups endpoints [13]

  • Use DeviceId when linking new devices [14]

  • Deprotocolize MessageBackup archivers and related impl-only types [15]

  • improve regional networking options [16]

  • Add BackupSettingsViewController, largely unimplemented [17]

  • Make linking debug builds easier [18]

  • Fix share extension loading indicator color [19]

  • Clean up Share Extension lifecycle notifications [20]

  • When writing a debug log, repeat logs about the local app state […] [21]

  • Clean up the Share Extension [22]

  • Fix loading & progress reporting in the Share Ext [23]

  • Use Retry.performWithBackoff for GV2 requests [24]

  • Fixed nested retries in GV2 code [25]

  • Use relativeString instead of relativePath [26]

  • Fix sleep blocking during backups/restores [27]

  • Asyncify PendingTasks [28]

  • Don’t fan out on GSE fetch network errors [29]

  • Asyncify showBadgeExpirationSheetIfNeeded [30]

  • Add SubscriptionFetcher, decoupled from donations [31]

  • Deprotocolize BackupSubscriptionManager [32]

  • Populate "backup plan" in BackupSettings with a subscription fetch [33]

  • Remove two unused-beyond-test inits for Subscription.ChargeFailure [34]

  • Don’t throw assertions when the app is expired [35]

  • Use Retry.performWithBackoff for pre key rotations [36]

  • OWSChatConnection: De-promisify libsignal requests […] [37]

  • OWSChatConnection: Avoid repeatedly cycling the libsignal socket […] [38]

  • Fix tests for xcode 16.3 [39]

  • Guard against too many group changes [40]

  • Update preferredFont to work with current UITraitCollection [41]

  • Add preview to RegistrationQuickRestoreQRCodeVC [42]

  • Use clampedNanoseconds where it’s useful [43]

  • Move DeviceSleepManager to the main app [44]

  • Use DeviceSleepManager in a few more places [45]

  • Update to libsignal v0.69.1 [46]

  • Enable libsignal-for-chat for everybody […] [47]

  • Block avatar downloads from message requests [48]

  • Don’t show “View Request” when requesting to join [49]

  • Don’t wait for group messages before NSE fetches [50]

  • Upgrade SwiftProtobuf to v1.29.0 [51]

  • OWSChatConnection: Don't race connection setup with sending requests […] [52]

  • Add and use BackupSettingsStore [53]

  • Move TSGroupThread.fetch(groupId:transaction:) to Swift [54]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.50.5 [55]

  • Sort remote configs [56]

  • Asyncify setShouldAllowUnrestrictedAccessLocal [57]

  • Line wrap names education labels [58]

  • When skipping PIN on re-registration, make sure to prompt to create a new one. [59]

  • Batch sender key “sent” updates [60]

  • Update release notes [61]

  • Update translations [62]

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: I still don’t really understand why limited access was picked over private access, although that might be an iOS restriction (can you only use private access or full access with no ability to change it in settings?)
“Settings” is not translated in the Dutch version on this moment. Not sure if need to report this in Translation Feedback or here.

posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked: Yep! That’s expected for now. We’re currently updating translations for in-app settings vs. system-wide settings, and the new translations should be available in a new beta that we’ll publish tomorrow.

New Version: 7.55.0.732-beta

2 new commits since 7.55.0.726-beta:

  • Pass in the ProvisioningSocketManager to avoid racing [1]

  • Update translations [2]

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.56 release.
